snippet: The ban, which carries fines and jail time for those who engage in such transactions without government approval, is an effort to prop up the Syrian pound, whose value has plummeted since 2011.
abstract: Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad bans the use of foreign currencies in business transactions, part of the government's effort to prop up the Syrian pound, which has plummeted to 200 pounds to the dollar from 47 to the dollar in March 2011.
lead_paragraph: The ban, which carries fines and jail time for those who engage in such transactions without government approval, is an effort to prop up the Syrian pound, whose value has plummeted since 2011.

headline.main: Syria Bans Use of Foreign Currencies for Business Deals
headline.print_headline: Syria Bans Use of Foreign Money in Business Transactions
